Camp Is Our Specialty. Joy Is Our Purpose.

Our Vision

Our vision is to bring joy and enrichment to the lives of special needs individuals and their loved ones.

Our Mission

Our mission is to serve individuals with special needs and demonstrate the love of Jesus through joy-filled, life-giving camps and year-round camper advocacy.

Help Keep Our Camps Going

Delivering joy Since 1975.

Since 1975, Special Camps has provided a safe and fun camp environment for children, youth and adults to experience the love of Jesus Christ and develop relationships that last a lifetime. In 1975, the need for camps for special needs children, youth, and adults was identified and brought to the attention of the North Alabama Conference of the United Methodist Church. A team was formed, volunteers recruited, and the message sent out to potential campers.

The camp was a success and the program began as a continuation of Christ’s love for all children of God. For over 40 years, the legacy of sharing God’s love and joy in a camp setting has continued due to the relationships built by the campers, families/guardian of campers, and volunteers. Special Camps campers and volunteers alike have been attending camp for years and years creating a family while welcoming new and young every new year.

There's a Special Camp for You.

Our primary goal is to provide a solid, joy-filled, Christ-focused camp experience. Campers at Special Camps will have a fun outdoor camp experience and learn about Christ’s love while creating lasting friendships with other campers and volunteers.

Camper Application

    Youth Camp - Ages 18-25

  • July 12 - July 17

    Adult Camp - Ages 26-45

  • July 12 - July 17

    Older Adult Camp - Ages 46+

Come experience authentic joy and sincere compassion.
